literary.t: I go back to the reading room, where I sink down in the sofa and into the world of The Arabian Nights. Slowly, like a movie fadeout, the real world evaporates. I'm alone, inside the world of the story. My favorite feeling in the world.

Since the library has just opened for the day, there's no one else there and I have the elegant reading room all to myself. Every once in a while a gentle breeze blows through the open window. I love the comfortable sofa.
If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.

Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. Inside our heads there’s a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. You’ll live forever in your own private library.
With my eyes closed, I would touch a familiar book and draw its fragrance deep inside me. This was enough to make me happy.
